title: Authentication Overview
content: All API requests require authentication using API keys. Include your API key in the Authorization header as a Bearer token. Example: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

title: Getting Started
content: To get started with our API, first create an account and generate an API key from the dashboard. Then make your first request to the /health endpoint to verify connectivity.

title: Rate Limiting
content: API requests are rate limited to 100 requests per minute per API key. When you exceed this limit, you'll receive a 429 status code. Use exponential backoff for retries.

title: Error Handling
content: Our API returns standard HTTP status codes. 200 for success, 400 for bad requests, 401 for authentication errors, 404 for not found, and 500 for server errors. All errors include a JSON body with an error message.

title: Webhook Configuration
content: Set up webhooks to receive real-time notifications about events. Configure webhook URLs in your dashboard and specify which events to subscribe to. Webhooks are signed for security.

title: Data Export
content: Export your data using the /export endpoint. Supports JSON and CSV formats. Large exports are processed asynchronously and you'll receive a download link via email.

title: API Versioning
content: Our API uses versioning in the URL path. Current version is v1. Example: https://api.example.com/v1/users. We maintain backward compatibility for at least 12 months after deprecation.

title: User Management
content: Create, update, and delete users via the /users endpoint. Supports pagination, filtering, and sorting. User objects include id, email, name, created_at, and custom metadata fields.

title: Search API
content: Perform full-text search across your data using the /search endpoint. Supports filters, faceting, and highlighting. Results are ranked by relevance and can be sorted by various fields.

title: Batch Operations
content: Process multiple operations in a single request using the /batch endpoint. Supports batch creation, updates, and deletions. Maximum batch size is 1000 items per request.
